snippet.title: Mario's Game Gallery (1995) PC Playthrough - NintendoComplete
snippet.description:
A complete playthrough of Presage's 1995 PC edutainment title, Mario's Game Gallery.

It's unfortunate that the only significant difference between these games and the free ones that used to be shoveled onto shareware discs back in the day is the Mario license. Considering the target age group though, it seems odd that there is no difficulty selection, Mario is brutal as an opponent here!

Oh, that, and this was the first time Charles Martinet ever voiced Mario (note the release date being earlier than Super Mario 64!)

The game features Checkers, Go Fish, Dominoes, Backgammon, and Yacht (a Yahtzee! ripoff). 

I hope you enjoy the absurd nonstop talking... my favorite has to be the disabled child screaming, "Mario! Go fish!" over and over again.



No cheats were used during the recording of this video. 

NintendoComplete (http://www.nintendocomplete.com/) punches you in the face with in-depth reviews, screenshot archives, and music from classic 8-bit NES games!

Visit for the latest updates!
